intro: Clematoclethra pingwuensis, commonly known as the Pingwu clethra, is a rare species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
